Structs/StreetView.html#/s:6OkCore10Stre.name: url
Structs/StreetView.html#/s:6OkCore10Stre.abstract: A Google’s StreetView Panorama Url, if the address was created using Google StreetView. See: https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/streetview

Structs/StreetView.html#/s:6OkCore10Stre.name: panoId
Structs/StreetView.html#/s:6OkCore10Stre.abstract: A Google’s StreetView Panorama Id, if the address was created using Google StreetView. See: https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/streetview

Protocols/OkHiLocationServiceDelegate.ht.name: okHiLocationService(locationService:didChangeLocationPermissionStatus:result:)
Protocols/OkHiLocationServiceDelegate.ht.abstract: Delegate event raised when location services permission changed

Enums/LocationPermissionType.html.name: LocationPermissionType
Enums/LocationPermissionType.html.abstract: Enum containing type of location permission requested

Classes/OkHiAuth.html#/s:6OkCore0A6HiAut.name: environment
Classes/OkHiAuth.html#/s:6OkCore0A6HiAut.abstract: Environment to run in. Possible Values “sandbox” - for testing, “prod” - for real data manipulation

Classes/OkHiAppContext.html#/s:6OkCore0A.name: platform
Classes/OkHiAppContext.html#/s:6OkCore0A.abstract: Current metadata information about the current running platform

Classes/OkHiAppContext.html#/s:6OkCore0A.name: developer
Classes/OkHiAppContext.html#/s:6OkCore0A.abstract: Current metadata information about the current developer integrating OkHi services

Classes/OkHiAppContext.html#/s:6OkCore0A.name: appMeta
Classes/OkHiAppContext.html#/s:6OkCore0A.abstract: Current metadata information about your application. May be nil if none is set via the OkHiContext

Classes/OkHiUser.html#/s:6OkCore0A6HiUse.name: phone
Classes/OkHiUser.html#/s:6OkCore0A6HiUse.abstract: The user’s phone number. Must be MSISDN standard format. e.g +254712345678

Classes/OkHiUser.html#/s:6OkCore0A6HiUse.name: id
Classes/OkHiUser.html#/s:6OkCore0A6HiUse.abstract: The OkHi’s userId. Usually obtained after a user successfully creates an OkHi address

Classes/OkHiLocation.html#/s:6OkCore0A10.name: id
Classes/OkHiLocation.html#/s:6OkCore0A10.abstract: The OkHi’s locationId. Usually obtained once an address has been successfully created by the user

Classes/OkHiLocation.html#/s:6OkCore0A10.name: userId
Classes/OkHiLocation.html#/s:6OkCore0A10.abstract: The OkHi’s userId. Usually obtained after a user successfully creates an OkHi address

Classes/OkHiLocation.html#/s:6OkCore0A10.name: geoPoint
Classes/OkHiLocation.html#/s:6OkCore0A10.abstract: Geo point containing lat, lon of the geo point

Classes/OkHiLocation.html#/s:6OkCore0A10.name: otherInformation
Classes/OkHiLocation.html#/s:6OkCore0A10.abstract: User generated meta information about the location, how to access it and any other relevant notes

Classes/OkHiLocation.html#/s:6OkCore0A10.name: url
Classes/OkHiLocation.html#/s:6OkCore0A10.abstract: A link to the user’s address visible on browser or desktop

Classes/OkHiLocation.html#/s:6OkCore0A10.name: plusCode
Classes/OkHiLocation.html#/s:6OkCore0A10.abstract: Geocode system for identifying an area anywhere on the Earth. See https://plus.codes/

Classes/OkHiLocation.html#/s:6OkCore0A10.name: photo
Classes/OkHiLocation.html#/s:6OkCore0A10.abstract: A link to the location’s gate photo

Classes/OkHiLocation.html#/s:6OkCore0A10.name: title
Classes/OkHiLocation.html#/s:6OkCore0A10.abstract: A string that can be used to render information about the location

Classes/OkHiLocation.html#/s:6OkCore0A10.name: subtitle
Classes/OkHiLocation.html#/s:6OkCore0A10.abstract: A string that can be used to render meta information about the location

Classes/OkHiError/ErrorMessages.html#/s:.name: unknown
Classes/OkHiError/ErrorMessages.html#/s:.abstract: Error is thrown whenever there’s an unknown error that occured during the usage of one of OkHi’s services

Classes/OkHiError/ErrorMessages.html#/s:.name: network
Classes/OkHiError/ErrorMessages.html#/s:.abstract: Error is thrown when the device can’t connect to OkHi’s servers

Classes/OkHiError/ErrorMessages.html#/s:.name: invalidPhone
Classes/OkHiError/ErrorMessages.html#/s:.abstract: Error is thrown whenever an invalid phone number is provided to a service that requires a user’s phone number

Classes/OkHiError/ErrorMessages.html#/s:.name: unauthorized
Classes/OkHiError/ErrorMessages.html#/s:.abstract: Error is thrown whenever there’s an issue with the credentials provided

Classes/OkHiError/ErrorMessages.html#/s:.name: unableToParse
Classes/OkHiError/ErrorMessages.html#/s:.abstract: Error is thrown when its impossible to parse response from server

Classes/OkHiError/ErrorMessages.html#/s:.name: webViewInternalHttp
Classes/OkHiError/ErrorMessages.html#/s:.abstract: Error is thrown when webview detects any error

Classes/OkHiError/ErrorMessages.html#/s:.name: missingLocationId
Classes/OkHiError/ErrorMessages.html#/s:.abstract: Error is thrown when location id was not specified

Classes/OkHiError/ErrorCodes.html#/s:6Ok.name: unknown
Classes/OkHiError/ErrorCodes.html#/s:6Ok.abstract: Error is thrown whenever there’s an unknown error that occured during the usage of one of OkHi’s services

Classes/OkHiError/ErrorCodes.html#/s:6Ok.name: network
Classes/OkHiError/ErrorCodes.html#/s:6Ok.abstract: Error is thrown when the device can’t connect to OkHi’s servers

Classes/OkHiError/ErrorCodes.html#/s:6Ok.name: invalidPhone
Classes/OkHiError/ErrorCodes.html#/s:6Ok.abstract: Error is thrown whenever an invalid phone number is provided to a service that requires a user’s phone number

Classes/OkHiError/ErrorCodes.html#/s:6Ok.name: unauthorized
Classes/OkHiError/ErrorCodes.html#/s:6Ok.abstract: Error is thrown whenever there’s an issue with the credentials provided

Classes/OkHiError/ErrorCodes.html#/s:6Ok.name: permisionDenied
Classes/OkHiError/ErrorCodes.html#/s:6Ok.abstract: Error is thrown whenever a particular permission is required for a service to run and isn’t granted by the user

Classes/OkHiError/ErrorCodes.html#/s:6Ok.name: unableToParse
Classes/OkHiError/ErrorCodes.html#/s:6Ok.abstract: Error is thrown when its impossible to parse response from server

Classes/OkHiError/ErrorCodes.html#/s:6Ok.name: webViewInternalHttp
Classes/OkHiError/ErrorCodes.html#/s:6Ok.abstract: Error is thrown when webview detects any error

Classes/OkHiError/ErrorCodes.html#/s:6Ok.name: missingLocationId
Classes/OkHiError/ErrorCodes.html#/s:6Ok.abstract: Error is thrown when location id was not specified

Classes/OkHiLocationService.html#/s:6OkC.name: isLocationPermissionGranted()
Classes/OkHiLocationService.html#/s:6OkC.abstract: Checks whether location permission is already granted

Classes/OkHiError.html.name: OkHiError
Classes/OkHiError.html.abstract: The OkHiError class extends the Error class to provide additional information regarding the type of errors thrown while running any OkHiLibraries. It contains static string properties that can be used to evaluate the kind of errors being thrown and handle them appropriately.

Classes/OkHiLocation.html.name: OkHiLocation
Classes/OkHiLocation.html.abstract: Defines OkHiLocation class once an address has been successfully created by the user.

Classes/OkHiUser.html.name: OkHiUser
Classes/OkHiUser.html.abstract: Defines OkHiUser class of the user object requried by OkHi services and libraries

Classes/OkHiAppContext.html.name: OkHiAppContext
Classes/OkHiAppContext.html.abstract: The OkHiAppContext class defines your current running context i.e what mode will you be using OkHi seervices. It also keeps track of your apps current version and build numbers which will assit in debigging purposes.
